result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael C. Kasch
Current: 7678 Dakota Capital Court, Wautoma, WI 54982 United States  (Effective: 06-01-2016)

ADDRESS INFO for Michael C. Kasch
Current: 7678 Dakota Capital Court, Wautoma, WI 54982 United States  (Effective: 06-01-2016)
Prior: PO Box 1002, Wautoma, WI 54982 United States
JOC returned by USPS - Unable to Forward

10:35 am cases called.15CM285, 15CM293 & 15CM299. Defendant Michael C. Kasch in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Anderson states agreement on the record. Attorney Zamzow concurs.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to 15CM293 & 15CM299. Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court dismisses outright the repeater enhancers on both 15CM293 & 15CM299 and dismisses and reads-in 15CM283.  No statement by the defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years. 2 days of credit if revoked. CONDITIONS: No contact with D. Sockness, M. Kratz, and/or Wautoma Express. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
State's

BOND APPLICABLE TO CASE NOS. 15CM285, 15CM293 & 15CM299. No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.

15CM285, 15CM293 & 15CM299 Case called @ 1:06 p.m. Defendant Michael C. Kasch in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD.  NGP entered.  ADA Anderson requesting a $2500 Sig Bond - DE is on a PO Hold. No objection by Atty Szilagyi. Court orders $2500 Sig Bond. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 10:25 am.
